block.p: A sports article on Sunday about the challenges facing Nascar after years of growth referred incorrectly to the finances of International Speedway Corporation, which owns many tracks where top races are run. The company's first-quarter revenue fell 4.5 percent compared with the same quarter a year ago -- not 19 percent, which was the decline in first-quarter earnings compared with the same period. The article also referred incompletely to the company's explanation for these declines. Aside from lower attendance and a drop in concessions sales, the company also cited higher expenses.
